title: Demon
data:
***Version [0.28](/0.28 "0.28")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

**Demons** are unholy monsters from the infernal planes of [Hell](/Hell "Hell"), [Pandemonium](/Pandemonium "Pandemonium"), and [the Abyss](/The_Abyss "The Abyss"). They range in difficulty from minor nuisances like the [crimson imp](/Crimson_imp "Crimson imp") to the mighty [Greater Demons](/Greater_Demon "Greater Demon"), and have a wide variety of powers. They can be brought into the world by [summoning](/Summoning "Summoning") them, and they also appear in later levels of the [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon"), especially the aforementioned infernal [branches](/Branch "Branch").

All demons are considered [evil](/Evil "Evil"), and take additional damage from [holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath")-branded weapons and [Holy Word](/Holy_Word "Holy Word"). Many [gods](/God "God") award [piety](/Piety "Piety") for destroying them. [Makhleb](/Makhleb "Makhleb") and [Xom](/Xom "Xom") may grant demonic servants to their worshipers.

In the ASCII version of *Crawl*, tiered demons are represented by a numeral representing their tier level (1-5). More powerful demons are represented by an ampersand (&).

## Contents

- [1 Demon List](#Demon_List)

  - [1.1 Tier-5 Demons](#Tier-5_Demons)
  - [1.2 Tier-4 Demons](#Tier-4_Demons)
  - [1.3 Tier-3 Demons](#Tier-3_Demons)
  - [1.4 Tier-2 Demons](#Tier-2_Demons)
  - [1.5 Tier-1 Demons](#Tier-1_Demons)
  - [1.6 Archdemons](#Archdemons)
  - [1.7 Demonic creatures](#Demonic_creatures)
  - [1.8 Unique demons](#Unique_demons)
  - [1.9 Retired demons](#Retired_demons)

## Demon List

### Tier-5 Demons

Tier-5 Demons are the weakest class of demons. They're common in the early dungeon, and are often summoned in droves by stronger creatures. Only fresh adventurers should have trouble dealing with these. The imps can be summoned by using [Call Imp](/Call_Imp "Call Imp").

5 [![Crimson imp.png](/images/0/0f/Crimson_imp.png)](/File:Crimson_imp.png) **[Crimson imp](/Crimson_imp "Crimson imp")**- A pesky little beast that [blinks](/Blink "Blink") often and regenerates. Very difficult to pin down and kill, but otherwise fairly harmless.

5 [![Iron imp.png](/images/b/b7/Iron_imp.png)](/File:Iron_imp.png) **[Iron imp](/Iron_imp "Iron imp")**- Metallic imps that are slow, but have more HP and melee power than other imps.

5 [![Lemure.png](/images/f/fa/Lemure.png)](/File:Lemure.png) **[Lemure](/Lemure "Lemure")**- Cursed souls bound into service to interdimensional slavers. Kill [their master](/Pikel "Pikel"), and they will go free.

5 [![Quasit.png](/images/1/1e/Quasit.png)](/File:Quasit.png) **[Quasit](/Quasit "Quasit")**- Small demons with decent HP and dexterity-draining melee attacks.

5 [![Shadow imp.png](/images/3/3d/Shadow_imp.png)](/File:Shadow_imp.png) **[Shadow imp](/Shadow_imp "Shadow imp")**- Minor demonic torturers that can cast [Pain](/Pain "Pain").

5 [![Ufetubus.png](/images/6/6c/Ufetubus.png)](/File:Ufetubus.png) **[Ufetubus](/Ufetubus "Ufetubus")**- Fast with decent EV, but is otherwise weak. Summoned in droves by the tier-3 [ynoxinul](/Ynoxinul "Ynoxinul").

5 [![White imp.png](/images/7/75/White_imp.png)](/File:White_imp.png) **[White imp](/White_imp "White imp")**- Frosty little demons that have [Throw Frost](/Throw_Frost "Throw Frost") and a [cold](/Cold "Cold")-flavoured melee attack.

### Tier-4 Demons

Tier-4 Demons are more powerful than tier-5 demons, but are still among some of the weakest demons in the game. None are capable of inflicting damage at long range, although a few possess other special abilities. They are occasionally granted as allies by [Makhleb](/Makhleb "Makhleb")'s Lesser Servant invocation.

4 [![Chaos spawn.png](/images/e/e7/Chaos_spawn.png)](/File:Chaos_spawn.png) **[Chaos spawn](/Chaos_spawn "Chaos spawn")**- Ever-shifting creatures that move swiftly and have [chaos](/Chaos "Chaos")-[branded](/Brand "Brand") melee attacks. They degenerate into clouds of raw chaos when killed.

4 [![Hellwing.png](/images/4/4a/Hellwing.png)](/File:Hellwing.png) **[Hellwing](/Hellwing "Hellwing")**- Skeletal demons that can soar over intervening creatures to attack their targets from behind.

4 [![Ice devil.png](/images/b/b5/Ice_devil.png)](/File:Ice_devil.png) **[Ice devil](/Ice_devil "Ice devil")**- Spell-less demons that nonetheless have powerful [cold](/Cold "Cold") attacks, though they dislike [fire](/Fire "Fire").

4 [![Orange demon.png](/images/3/39/Orange_demon.png)](/File:Orange_demon.png) **[Orange demon](/Orange_demon "Orange demon")**- Demons with venomous stinger tails that can [reach](/Reaching "Reaching") out and inflict [weakness](/Weakness "Weakness").

4 [![Red devil.png](/images/d/db/Red_devil.png)](/File:Red_devil.png) **[Red devil](/Red_devil "Red devil")**- Flying devils that coat their [tridents](/Trident "Trident") with [barbs](/Barbs "Barbs"). Vulnerable to cold.

4 [![Rust devil.png](/images/1/18/Rust_devil.png)](/File:Rust_devil.png) **[Rust devil](/Rust_devil "Rust devil")**- Metallic demons with multiple resistances and [corrosive](/Acid "Acid") attacks.

### Tier-3 Demons

Tier-3 Demons are demons of average power that display an assortment of capabilities. Some are notably more dangerous than others.

3 [![Neqoxec.png](/images/0/05/Neqoxec.png)](/File:Neqoxec.png) **[Neqoxec](/Neqoxec "Neqoxec")**- It will gladly [malmutate](/Malmutate "Malmutate") you, drain your [intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence"), or summon imps to attack you.

3 [![Sixfirhy.png](/images/e/eb/Sixfirhy.png)](/File:Sixfirhy.png) **[Sixfirhy](/Sixfirhy "Sixfirhy")**- An electrical imp that moves in bursts of blinding speed. Relatively weak, but very painful if you are not resistant to [electricity](/Electricity "Electricity").

3 [![Smoke demon.png](/images/e/ea/Smoke_demon.png)](/File:Smoke_demon.png) **[Smoke demon](/Smoke_demon "Smoke demon")**- Demons of living smoke that are dangerous at range with [Sticky Flame Range](/Sticky_Flame_Range "Sticky Flame Range"), [Steam Ball](/Steam_Ball "Steam Ball"), and [Smite](/Smite "Smite").

3 [![Soul eater.png](/images/8/88/Soul_eater.png)](/File:Soul_eater.png) **[Soul eater](/Soul_eater "Soul eater")**- Moderately powerful demons that can [Drain Life](/Drain_Life "Drain Life") out of nearby foes.

3 [![Sun demon.png](/images/f/f0/Sun_demon.png)](/File:Sun_demon.png) **[Sun demon](/Sun_demon "Sun demon")**- Speedy fire demons that have powerful, fiery attacks but are vulnerable to cold.

3 [![Ynoxinul.png](/images/9/9f/Ynoxinul.png)](/File:Ynoxinul.png) **[Ynoxinul](/Ynoxinul "Ynoxinul")**- A summoner of [ufetubi](/Ufetubi "Ufetubi") which can also cast [Iron Shot](/Iron_Shot "Iron Shot").

### Tier-2 Demons

Tier-2 Demons are challenging combatants due to a wide range of abilities. They are the second most powerful tier of standard demon. Additionally, a worshipper of [Makhleb](/Makhleb "Makhleb") may summon some of them using the Greater Servant ability.

2 [![Balrug.png](/images/2/21/Balrug.png)](/File:Balrug.png) **[Balrug](/Balrug "Balrug")**- Huge, fast demons that wield branded [demon whips](/Demon_whip "Demon whip"), cast powerful fire magic, and [smite](/Smite "Smite") their foes.

2 [![Blizzard demon.png](/images/2/25/Blizzard_demon.png)](/File:Blizzard_demon.png) **[Blizzard demon](/Blizzard_demon "Blizzard demon")**- Demons that are capable of casting powerful [Air](/Air_Magic "Air Magic") and [Ice Magic](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic") spells.

2 [![Cacodemon.png](/images/5/58/Cacodemon.png)](/File:Cacodemon.png) **[Cacodemon](/Cacodemon "Cacodemon")**- A dangerous, debilitating demon that can cast [Malmutate](/Malmutate "Malmutate"), [Slow](/Slow "Slow"), and [Confuse](/Confuse "Confuse"). They can also dig through walls or pelt you with energy bolts.

2 [![Green death.png](/images/4/40/Green_death.png)](/File:Green_death.png) **[Green death](/Green_death "Green death")**- Demons that attack you with all manner of dangerous toxins.

2 [![Hell beast.png](/images/6/6e/Hell_beast.png)](/File:Hell_beast.png) **[Hell beast](/Hell_beast "Hell beast")**- Dangerous melee demons that can trample foes out of position. The [Horn of Geryon](/Horn_of_Geryon "Horn of Geryon") can call in hordes of them.

2 [![Hellion.png](/images/c/cf/Hellion.png)](/File:Hellion.png) **[Hellion](/Hellion "Hellion")**- Demons that specialize in pelting you with smite-targeted [damnation](/Damnation "Damnation").

2 [![Lorocyproca.png](/images/c/c0/Lorocyproca.png)](/File:Lorocyproca.png) **[Lorocyproca](/Lorocyproca "Lorocyproca")**- Invisible demons that resist all elements and drain your MP with their attacks.

2 [![Reaper.png](/images/6/6a/Reaper.png)](/File:Reaper.png) **[Reaper](/Reaper "Reaper")**- The archetypal Grim Reapers. They wield branded [scythes](/Scythe "Scythe") and can deal heavy melee damage.

2 [![Shadow demon.png](/images/a/a8/Shadow_demon.png)](/File:Shadow_demon.png) **[Shadow demon](/Shadow_demon "Shadow demon")**- Demonic summoners which can quickly flood their surroundings with summoned demons and [Shadow Creatures](/Shadow_Creatures "Shadow Creatures").

2 [![Tormentor.png](/images/3/3d/Tormentor.png)](/File:Tormentor.png) **[Tormentor](/Tormentor "Tormentor")**- A demon that casts [Pain](/Pain "Pain") and [Torment](/Torment "Torment") and is faster than average.

### Tier-1 Demons

Tier-1 Demons (also known as Greater Demons) are among the deadliest opponents in *Dungeon Crawl*. All tier-1 demons can see invisible, and all Fiends are capable of inflicting [Torment](/Torment "Torment"). Fighting or even being in sight of multiple tier-1 demons is not recommended.

1 [![Brimstone fiend.png](/images/7/72/Brimstone_fiend.png)](/File:Brimstone_fiend.png) **[Brimstone fiend](/Brimstone_fiend "Brimstone fiend")**- Fiends that specialize in [damnation](/Damnation "Damnation") as well as torment. Vulnerable to cold.

1 [![Executioner.png](/images/9/93/Executioner.png)](/File:Executioner.png) **[Executioner](/Executioner "Executioner")**- Moves twice as fast as normal and will cast [Haste](/Haste "Haste") at the slightest provocation. With its speed and 3 melee attacks, it can tear lightly armoured characters to shreds.

1 [![Hell Sentinel.png](/images/d/dd/Hell_Sentinel.png)](/File:Hell_Sentinel.png) **[Hell sentinel](/Hell_sentinel "Hell sentinel")**- A highly durable demonic construct with painful [spines](/Spiny "Spiny") and both [Damnation](/Damnation "Damnation") and [Iron Shot](/Iron_Shot "Iron Shot").

1 [![Ice Fiend.png](/images/a/a8/Ice_Fiend.png)](/File:Ice_Fiend.png) **[Ice fiend](/Ice_fiend "Ice fiend")**- Fiends that have torment and [Bolt of Cold](/Bolt_of_Cold "Bolt of Cold"), but are most dangerous in melee with their powerful freezing attacks. Vulnerable to fire.

1 [![Tzitzimitl.png](/images/0/02/Tzitzimitl.png)](/File:Tzitzimitl.png) **[Tzitzimitl](/Tzitzimitl "Tzitzimitl")**- Terrifying divinities that can damage both the living and the undead with an assortment of cold and negative energy spells.

### Archdemons

The most powerful demons of them all, these beings are all [unique](/Unique "Unique") creatures that are usually found as boss-type enemies. Many of them serve as guardians of various [runes of Zot](/Runes_of_Zot "Runes of Zot").

& [![Geryon.png](/images/f/f4/Geryon.png)](/File:Geryon.png) **[Geryon](/Geryon "Geryon")**- The gatekeeper of [Hell](/Hell "Hell"), Geryon stands between adventurers and the entrances to the four hells. His [horn](/Horn_of_Geryon "Horn of Geryon") can call in endless waves of [hell beasts](/Hell_beast "Hell beast").

& [![Asmodeus.png](/images/3/34/Asmodeus.png)](/File:Asmodeus.png) **[Asmodeus](/Asmodeus "Asmodeus")**- Lord of [Gehenna](/Gehenna "Gehenna") and unparalleled master of [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic"), Asmodeus guards the obsidian rune of Zot.

& [![Dispater.png](/images/f/fa/Dispater.png)](/File:Dispater.png) **[Dispater](/Dispater "Dispater")**- Lord of [the Iron City of Dis](/The_Iron_City_of_Dis "The Iron City of Dis"), Dispater commands powerful [Earth Magic](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic") and legions of powerful demons. His vaults hold the iron rune of Zot.

& [![Ereshkigal.png](/images/a/a8/Ereshkigal.png)](/File:Ereshkigal.png) **[Ereshkigal](/Ereshkigal "Ereshkigal")**- Lady of [Tartarus](/Tartarus "Tartarus"), she can [paralyze](/Paralyze "Paralyze"), [torment](/Torment "Torment"), and [silence](/Silence "Silence") her foes. She was charged with protecting the bone rune of Zot.

C [![Antaeus.png](/images/0/01/Antaeus.png)](/File:Antaeus.png) **[Antaeus](/Antaeus "Antaeus")**- A corrupted [titan](/Titan "Titan") who rules over [Cocytus](/Cocytus "Cocytus"). Antaeus fights foes with his massive strength augmented by powerful [Ice](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic") and [Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic"). He watches over the icy rune of Zot.

& [![Pandemonium lord.png](/images/c/c6/Pandemonium_lord.png)](/File:Pandemonium_lord.png) **[Pandemonium lord](/Pandemonium_lord "Pandemonium lord")**- Powerful demons that individually rule portions of [Pandemonium](/Pandemonium "Pandemonium"). Their powers and appearances vary greatly.

& [![Mnoleg.png](/images/a/ad/Mnoleg.png)](/File:Mnoleg.png) **[Mnoleg](/Mnoleg "Mnoleg")**- Guardian of the glowing rune of Zot, Mnoleg and its minions will [malmutate](/Malmutate "Malmutate") the crap out of anyone who challenges them... if they don't eat your brains first.

& [![Lom Lobon.png](/images/f/f6/Lom_Lobon.png)](/File:Lom_Lobon.png) **[Lom Lobon](/Lom_Lobon "Lom Lobon")**- Guardian of the magical rune of Zot, Lom Lobon possesses some of the strongest spells in the game and heads a cabal of [wizards](/Wizard_\(monster\) "Wizard (monster)").

& [![Cerebov.png](/images/c/c5/Cerebov.png)](/File:Cerebov.png) **[Cerebov](/Cerebov "Cerebov")**- Guardian of the fiery rune of Zot, Cerebov's [sword](/Sword_of_Cerebov "Sword of Cerebov") allows it to burn even those with full fire resistance.

& [![Gloorx Vloq.png](/images/9/97/Gloorx_Vloq.png)](/File:Gloorx_Vloq.png) **[Gloorx Vloq](/Gloorx_Vloq "Gloorx Vloq")**- Guardian of the dark rune of Zot, Gloorx Vloq is extremely fast and can seriously harm both the living and the undead.

### Demonic creatures

While not considered standard demons in and of themselves, these creatures have demonic [holiness](/Holiness "Holiness"), making them vulnerable to weapons of [holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath").

t [![Apocalypse crab.png](/images/8/88/Apocalypse_crab.png)](/File:Apocalypse_crab.png) **[Apocalypse crab](/Apocalypse_crab "Apocalypse crab")**- [Abyssal](/Abyss "Abyss") crustaceans that spew clouds of pure [chaos](/Chaos "Chaos") at their prey.

x [![Small abomination.png](/images/b/b3/Small_abomination.png)](/File:Small_abomination.png) **[Small abomination](/Small_abomination "Small abomination")**- Horrible mockeries of life made from several corpses that have been mashed haphazardly together.

X [![Large abomination.png](/images/5/51/Large_abomination.png)](/File:Large_abomination.png) **[Large abomination](/Large_abomination "Large abomination")**- Unrecognizable combinations of body parts that are somewhat slower but far more powerful than their smaller brethren.

s [![Demonic crawler.png](/images/0/01/Demonic_crawler.png)](/File:Demonic_crawler.png) **[Demonic crawler](/Demonic_crawler "Demonic crawler")**- Swift demonic bugs that are often found in the [Spider's Nest](/Spider%27s_Nest "Spider's Nest").

h [![Doom hound.png](/images/6/67/Doom_hound.png)](/File:Doom_hound.png) **[Doom hound](/Doom_hound "Doom hound")**- Demonic [hounds](/List_of_canines "List of canines") that roam [Tartarus](/Tartarus "Tartarus"). Their howls attract the attention of other residents of that deathly realm.

R [![Efreet.png](/images/f/f9/Efreet.png)](/File:Efreet.png) **[Efreet](/Efreet "Efreet")**- Spirits of fire who wield [flaming](/Flaming "Flaming") [scimitars](/Scimitar "Scimitar") and powerful [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic").

h [![Hell hound.png](/images/b/bc/Hell_hound.png)](/File:Hell_hound.png) **[Hell hound](/Hell_hound "Hell hound")**- Fire-breathing [canines](/List_of_canines "List of canines") that travel in packs.

h [![Hell hog.png](/images/b/be/Hell_hog.png)](/File:Hell_hog.png) **[Hell hog](/Hell_hog "Hell hog")**- Demonic swine that travel in small herds and breathe [Fireballs](/Fireball "Fireball").

Y [![Hellephant.png](/images/6/66/Hellephant.png)](/File:Hellephant.png) **[Hellephant](/Hellephant "Hellephant")**- Enormous, hellish [elephants](/Elephant "Elephant") that will roast you with their fire breath before trampling you to jelly.

R [![Rakshasa.png](/images/9/99/Rakshasa.png)](/File:Rakshasa.png) **[Rakshasa](/Rakshasa "Rakshasa")**- Demons that specialize in illusions. They hide themselves in a crowd of illusory copies.

X [![Tentacled monstrosity.png](/images/3/37/Tentacled_monstrosity.png)](/File:Tentacled_monstrosity.png) **[Tentacled monstrosity](/Tentacled_monstrosity "Tentacled monstrosity")**- Enormous tentacled behemoths that roam the [Realm of Zot](/Realm_of_Zot "Realm of Zot") and can swiftly crush the life out of those who allow them into close combat.

R [![Wendigo.png](/images/8/8a/Wendigo.png)](/File:Wendigo.png) **[Wendigo](/Wendigo "Wendigo")**- Demons that fire paralysing bolts of electricity and shatter [simulacra](/Simulacra "Simulacra") into devastating explosions of icy fragments.

### Unique demons

These beings aren't powerful enough to be archdemons but are strong enough to be particularly noteworthy.

R [![Azrael.png](/images/f/fa/Azrael.png)](/File:Azrael.png) **[Azrael](/Azrael "Azrael")**- An [efreet](/Efreet "Efreet") who has learned how to hurl [damnation](/Damnation "Damnation") in addition to more more mundane types of fire. Travels with a pack of fiery underlings.

5 [![Grinder.png](/images/2/21/Grinder.png)](/File:Grinder.png) **[Grinder](/Grinder "Grinder")**- A notoriously deadly [shadow imp](/Shadow_imp "Shadow imp") who appears dangerously early in the [Dungeon](/Dungeon "Dungeon").

1 [![Ignacio.png](/images/4/40/Ignacio.png)](/File:Ignacio.png) **[Ignacio](/Ignacio "Ignacio")**- An [executioner](/Executioner "Executioner") who is even more deadly than usual, thanks in no small part to the [executioner's axe](/Executioner%27s_axe "Executioner's axe") he carries.

R [![Mara.png](/images/2/23/Mara.png)](/File:Mara.png) **[Mara](/Mara "Mara")**- Master of illusions, Mara can force his foes to fight their double. His own magic isn't anything to sneeze at, either.

Y [![Nellie.png](/images/e/e9/Nellie.png)](/File:Nellie.png) **[Nellie](/Nellie "Nellie")**- An unusually beefy [hellephant](/Hellephant "Hellephant") that only appears in [Dungeon Sprint](/Dungeon_Sprint "Dungeon Sprint").

D [![Serpent of Hell (Gehenna).png](/images/a/aa/Serpent_of_Hell_%28Gehenna%29.png)](/File:Serpent_of_Hell_\(Gehenna\).png)[![Serpent of Hell (Cocytus).png](/images/0/0f/Serpent_of_Hell_%28Cocytus%29.png)](/File:Serpent_of_Hell_\(Cocytus\).png)[![Serpent of Hell (Tartarus).png](/images/e/e7/Serpent_of_Hell_%28Tartarus%29.png)](/File:Serpent_of_Hell_\(Tartarus\).png)[![Serpent of Hell (Dis).png](/images/a/a2/Serpent_of_Hell_%28Dis%29.png)](/File:Serpent_of_Hell_\(Dis\).png) **[Serpent of Hell](/Serpent_of_Hell "Serpent of Hell")** - A three-headed demonic [dragon](/List_of_dragons "List of dragons") that changes its appearance and abilities to match the [Hell](/Hell "Hell") it resides in.

### Retired demons

5 [![Midge.png](/images/d/d5/Midge.png)](/File:Midge.png) **[Midge](/Midge "Midge")**- Tiny, flying imps that were little more than minor nuisances at best.

4 [![Hairy devil.png](/images/1/1c/Hairy_devil.png)](/File:Hairy_devil.png) **[Hairy devil](/Hairy_devil "Hairy devil")**- Boring and weak demonic melee fighters.

4 [![Iron devil.png](/images/a/aa/Iron_devil.png)](/File:Iron_devil.png) **[Iron devil](/Iron_devil "Iron devil")**- Upgraded iron imps with good AC and a variety of resistances. Replaced with [rust devils](/Rust_devil "Rust devil").

1 [![Pit fiend.png](/images/9/95/Pit_fiend.png)](/File:Pit_fiend.png) **[Pit fiend](/Pit_fiend "Pit fiend")**- Huge winged demons that could cast both [hellfire](/Hellfire "Hellfire") and [torment](/Torment "Torment"). Were removed in favor of [hell sentinels](/Hell_sentinel "Hell sentinel").

4 [![Rotting devil.png](/images/7/74/Rotting_devil.png)](/File:Rotting_devil.png) **[Rotting devil](/Rotting_devil "Rotting devil")**- Shambling demons that inflicted [rot](/Rot "Rot") with their fetid touch and trailed clouds of [miasma](/Miasma "Miasma") wherever they went.

4 [![Blue devil.png](/images/a/a4/Blue_devil.png)](/File:Blue_devil.png) **[Blue devil](/Blue_devil "Blue devil")**- Flying devils that resisted cold and poison, but were vulnerable to fire. They had no spells, but could swoop towards their targets from several tiles away.
html:
Demon

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.28: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

Demons are unholy monsters from the infernal planes of Hell, Pandemonium, and the Abyss. They range in difficulty from minor nuisances like the crimson imp to the mighty Greater Demons, and have a wide variety of powers. They can be brought into the world by summoning them, and they also appear in later levels of the Dungeon, especially the aforementioned infernal branches.

All demons are considered evil, and take additional damage from holy wrath-branded weapons and Holy Word. Many gods award piety for destroying them. Makhleb and Xom may grant demonic servants to their worshipers.

In the ASCII version of Crawl, tiered demons are represented by a numeral representing their tier level (1-5). More powerful demons are represented by an ampersand (&).

Contents

  • 1 Demon List
    • 1.1 Tier-5 Demons
    • 1.2 Tier-4 Demons
    • 1.3 Tier-3 Demons
    • 1.4 Tier-2 Demons
    • 1.5 Tier-1 Demons
    • 1.6 Archdemons
    • 1.7 Demonic creatures
    • 1.8 Unique demons
    • 1.9 Retired demons

Demon List

Tier-5 Demons

Tier-5 Demons are the weakest class of demons. They're common in the early dungeon, and are often summoned in droves by stronger creatures. Only fresh adventurers should have trouble dealing with these. The imps can be summoned by using Call Imp.

5 Crimson imp- A pesky little beast that blinks often and regenerates. Very difficult to pin down and kill, but otherwise fairly harmless.

5 Iron imp- Metallic imps that are slow, but have more HP and melee power than other imps.

5 Lemure- Cursed souls bound into service to interdimensional slavers. Kill their master, and they will go free.

5 Quasit- Small demons with decent HP and dexterity-draining melee attacks.

5 Shadow imp- Minor demonic torturers that can cast Pain.

5 Ufetubus- Fast with decent EV, but is otherwise weak. Summoned in droves by the tier-3 ynoxinul.

5 White imp- Frosty little demons that have Throw Frost and a cold-flavoured melee attack.

Tier-4 Demons

Tier-4 Demons are more powerful than tier-5 demons, but are still among some of the weakest demons in the game. None are capable of inflicting damage at long range, although a few possess other special abilities. They are occasionally granted as allies by Makhleb's Lesser Servant invocation.

4 Chaos spawn- Ever-shifting creatures that move swiftly and have chaos-branded melee attacks. They degenerate into clouds of raw chaos when killed.

4 Hellwing- Skeletal demons that can soar over intervening creatures to attack their targets from behind.

4 Ice devil- Spell-less demons that nonetheless have powerful cold attacks, though they dislike fire.

4 Orange demon- Demons with venomous stinger tails that can reach out and inflict weakness.

4 Red devil- Flying devils that coat their tridents with barbs. Vulnerable to cold.

4 Rust devil- Metallic demons with multiple resistances and corrosive attacks.

Tier-3 Demons

Tier-3 Demons are demons of average power that display an assortment of capabilities. Some are notably more dangerous than others.

3 Neqoxec- It will gladly malmutate you, drain your intelligence, or summon imps to attack you.

3 Sixfirhy- An electrical imp that moves in bursts of blinding speed. Relatively weak, but very painful if you are not resistant to electricity.

3 Smoke demon- Demons of living smoke that are dangerous at range with Sticky Flame Range, Steam Ball, and Smite.

3 Soul eater- Moderately powerful demons that can Drain Life out of nearby foes.

3 Sun demon- Speedy fire demons that have powerful, fiery attacks but are vulnerable to cold.

3 Ynoxinul- A summoner of ufetubi which can also cast Iron Shot.

Tier-2 Demons

Tier-2 Demons are challenging combatants due to a wide range of abilities. They are the second most powerful tier of standard demon. Additionally, a worshipper of Makhleb may summon some of them using the Greater Servant ability.

2 Balrug- Huge, fast demons that wield branded demon whips, cast powerful fire magic, and smite their foes.

2 Blizzard demon- Demons that are capable of casting powerful Air and Ice Magic spells.

2 Cacodemon- A dangerous, debilitating demon that can cast Malmutate, Slow, and Confuse. They can also dig through walls or pelt you with energy bolts.

2 Green death- Demons that attack you with all manner of dangerous toxins.

2 Hell beast- Dangerous melee demons that can trample foes out of position. The Horn of Geryon can call in hordes of them.

2 Hellion- Demons that specialize in pelting you with smite-targeted damnation.

2 Lorocyproca- Invisible demons that resist all elements and drain your MP with their attacks.

2 Reaper- The archetypal Grim Reapers. They wield branded scythes and can deal heavy melee damage.

2 Shadow demon- Demonic summoners which can quickly flood their surroundings with summoned demons and Shadow Creatures.

2 Tormentor- A demon that casts Pain and Torment and is faster than average.

Tier-1 Demons

Tier-1 Demons (also known as Greater Demons) are among the deadliest opponents in Dungeon Crawl. All tier-1 demons can see invisible, and all Fiends are capable of inflicting Torment. Fighting or even being in sight of multiple tier-1 demons is not recommended.

1 Brimstone fiend- Fiends that specialize in damnation as well as torment. Vulnerable to cold.

1 Executioner- Moves twice as fast as normal and will cast Haste at the slightest provocation. With its speed and 3 melee attacks, it can tear lightly armoured characters to shreds.

1 Hell sentinel- A highly durable demonic construct with painful spines and both Damnation and Iron Shot.

1 Ice fiend- Fiends that have torment and Bolt of Cold, but are most dangerous in melee with their powerful freezing attacks. Vulnerable to fire.

1 Tzitzimitl- Terrifying divinities that can damage both the living and the undead with an assortment of cold and negative energy spells.

Archdemons

The most powerful demons of them all, these beings are all unique creatures that are usually found as boss-type enemies. Many of them serve as guardians of various runes of Zot.

& Geryon- The gatekeeper of Hell, Geryon stands between adventurers and the entrances to the four hells. His horn can call in endless waves of hell beasts.

& Asmodeus- Lord of Gehenna and unparalleled master of Fire Magic, Asmodeus guards the obsidian rune of Zot.

& Dispater- Lord of the Iron City of Dis, Dispater commands powerful Earth Magic and legions of powerful demons. His vaults hold the iron rune of Zot.

& Ereshkigal- Lady of Tartarus, she can paralyze, torment, and silence her foes. She was charged with protecting the bone rune of Zot.

C Antaeus- A corrupted titan who rules over Cocytus. Antaeus fights foes with his massive strength augmented by powerful Ice and Air Magic. He watches over the icy rune of Zot.

& Pandemonium lord- Powerful demons that individually rule portions of Pandemonium. Their powers and appearances vary greatly.

& Mnoleg- Guardian of the glowing rune of Zot, Mnoleg and its minions will malmutate the crap out of anyone who challenges them... if they don't eat your brains first.

& Lom Lobon- Guardian of the magical rune of Zot, Lom Lobon possesses some of the strongest spells in the game and heads a cabal of wizards.

& Cerebov- Guardian of the fiery rune of Zot, Cerebov's sword allows it to burn even those with full fire resistance.

& Gloorx Vloq- Guardian of the dark rune of Zot, Gloorx Vloq is extremely fast and can seriously harm both the living and the undead.

Demonic creatures

While not considered standard demons in and of themselves, these creatures have demonic holiness, making them vulnerable to weapons of holy wrath.

t Apocalypse crab- Abyssal crustaceans that spew clouds of pure chaos at their prey.

x Small abomination- Horrible mockeries of life made from several corpses that have been mashed haphazardly together.

X Large abomination- Unrecognizable combinations of body parts that are somewhat slower but far more powerful than their smaller brethren.

s Demonic crawler- Swift demonic bugs that are often found in the Spider's Nest.

h Doom hound- Demonic hounds that roam Tartarus. Their howls attract the attention of other residents of that deathly realm.

R Efreet- Spirits of fire who wield flaming scimitars and powerful Fire Magic.

h Hell hound- Fire-breathing canines that travel in packs.

h Hell hog- Demonic swine that travel in small herds and breathe Fireballs.

Y Hellephant- Enormous, hellish elephants that will roast you with their fire breath before trampling you to jelly.

R Rakshasa- Demons that specialize in illusions. They hide themselves in a crowd of illusory copies.

X Tentacled monstrosity- Enormous tentacled behemoths that roam the Realm of Zot and can swiftly crush the life out of those who allow them into close combat.

R Wendigo- Demons that fire paralysing bolts of electricity and shatter simulacra into devastating explosions of icy fragments.

Unique demons

These beings aren't powerful enough to be archdemons but are strong enough to be particularly noteworthy.

R Azrael- An efreet who has learned how to hurl damnation in addition to more more mundane types of fire. Travels with a pack of fiery underlings.

5 Grinder- A notoriously deadly shadow imp who appears dangerously early in the Dungeon.

1 Ignacio- An executioner who is even more deadly than usual, thanks in no small part to the executioner's axe he carries.

R Mara- Master of illusions, Mara can force his foes to fight their double. His own magic isn't anything to sneeze at, either.

Y Nellie- An unusually beefy hellephant that only appears in Dungeon Sprint.

D Serpent of Hell - A three-headed demonic dragon that changes its appearance and abilities to match the Hell it resides in.

Retired demons

5 Midge- Tiny, flying imps that were little more than minor nuisances at best.

4 Hairy devil- Boring and weak demonic melee fighters.

4 Iron devil- Upgraded iron imps with good AC and a variety of resistances. Replaced with rust devils.

1 Pit fiend- Huge winged demons that could cast both hellfire and torment. Were removed in favor of hell sentinels.

4 Rotting devil- Shambling demons that inflicted rot with their fetid touch and trailed clouds of miasma wherever they went.

4 Blue devil- Flying devils that resisted cold and poison, but were vulnerable to fire. They had no spells, but could swoop towards their targets from several tiles away.

rawPage:
{{version028}}
'''Demons''' are unholy monsters from the infernal planes of [[Hell]], [[Pandemonium]], and [[the Abyss]]. They range in difficulty from minor nuisances like the [[crimson imp]] to the mighty [[Greater Demon]]s, and have a wide variety of powers. They can be brought into the world by [[summoning]] them, and they also appear in later levels of the [[Dungeon]], especially the aforementioned infernal [[branch]]es.

All demons are considered [[evil]], and take additional damage from [[holy wrath]]-branded weapons and [[Holy Word]]. Many [[god]]s award [[piety]] for destroying them. [[Makhleb]] and [[Xom]] may grant demonic servants to their worshipers.

In the ASCII version of ''Crawl'', tiered demons are represented by a numeral representing their tier level (1-5). More powerful demons are represented by an ampersand (&).

==Demon List==
===Tier-5 Demons===
Tier-5 Demons are the weakest class of demons. They're common in the early dungeon, and are often summoned in droves by stronger creatures. Only fresh adventurers should have trouble dealing with these. The imps can be summoned by using [[Call Imp]].

{{monsterlink|Crimson imp}}- A pesky little beast that [[blink]]s often and regenerates. Very difficult to pin down and kill, but otherwise fairly harmless.

{{monsterlink|Iron imp}}- Metallic imps that are slow, but have more HP and melee power than other imps.

{{monsterlink|Lemure}}- Cursed souls bound into service to interdimensional slavers. Kill [[Pikel|their master]], and they will go free.

{{monsterlink|Quasit}}- Small demons with decent HP and dexterity-draining melee attacks.

{{monsterlink|Shadow imp}}- Minor demonic torturers that can cast [[Pain]].

{{monsterlink|Ufetubus}}- Fast with decent EV, but is otherwise weak. Summoned in droves by the tier-3 [[ynoxinul]].

{{monsterlink|White imp}}- Frosty little demons that have [[Throw Frost]] and a [[cold]]-flavoured melee attack.

===Tier-4 Demons===
Tier-4 Demons are more powerful than tier-5 demons, but are still among some of the weakest demons in the game.  None are capable of inflicting damage at long range, although a few possess other special abilities. They are occasionally granted as allies by [[Makhleb]]'s Lesser Servant invocation.

{{monsterlink|Chaos spawn}}- Ever-shifting creatures that move swiftly and have [[chaos]]-[[brand]]ed melee attacks. They degenerate into clouds of raw chaos when killed.

{{monsterlink|Hellwing}}- Skeletal demons that can soar over intervening creatures to attack their targets from behind.

{{monsterlink|Ice devil}}- Spell-less demons that nonetheless have powerful [[cold]] attacks, though they dislike [[fire]].

{{monsterlink|Orange demon}}- Demons with venomous stinger tails that can [[reaching|reach]] out and inflict [[weakness]].

{{monsterlink|Red devil}}- Flying devils that coat their [[trident]]s with [[barbs]]. Vulnerable to cold.

{{monsterlink|Rust devil}}- Metallic demons with multiple resistances and [[acid|corrosive]] attacks.

===Tier-3 Demons===
Tier-3 Demons are demons of average power that display an assortment of capabilities. Some are notably more dangerous than others.

{{monsterlink|Neqoxec}}- It will gladly [[malmutate]] you, drain your [[intelligence]], or summon imps to attack you.

{{monsterlink|Sixfirhy}}- An electrical imp that moves in bursts of blinding speed. Relatively weak, but very painful if you are not resistant to [[electricity]].

{{monsterlink|Smoke demon}}- Demons of living smoke that are dangerous at range with [[Sticky Flame Range]], [[Steam Ball]], and [[Smite]].

{{monsterlink|Soul eater}}- Moderately powerful demons that can [[Drain Life]] out of nearby foes.

{{monsterlink|Sun demon}}- Speedy fire demons that have powerful, fiery attacks but are vulnerable to cold.

{{monsterlink|Ynoxinul}}- A summoner of [[ufetubi]] which can also cast [[Iron Shot]].

===Tier-2 Demons===
Tier-2 Demons are challenging combatants due to a wide range of abilities. They are the second most powerful tier of standard demon. Additionally, a worshipper of [[Makhleb]] may summon some of them using the Greater Servant ability.

{{monsterlink|Balrug}}- Huge, fast demons that wield branded [[demon whip]]s, cast powerful fire magic, and [[smite]] their foes. 

{{monsterlink|Blizzard demon}}- Demons that are capable of casting powerful [[Air Magic|Air]] and [[Ice Magic]] spells.

{{monsterlink|Cacodemon}}- A dangerous, debilitating demon that can cast [[Malmutate]], [[Slow]], and [[Confuse]]. They can also dig through walls or pelt you with energy bolts.

{{monsterlink|Green death}}- Demons that attack you with all manner of dangerous toxins.

{{monsterlink|Hell beast}}- Dangerous melee demons that can trample foes out of position. The [[Horn of Geryon]] can call in hordes of them.

{{monsterlink|Hellion}}- Demons that specialize in pelting you with smite-targeted [[damnation]].

{{monsterlink|Lorocyproca}}- Invisible demons that resist all elements and drain your MP with their attacks.

{{monsterlink|Reaper}}- The archetypal Grim Reapers. They wield branded [[scythe]]s and can deal heavy melee damage. 

{{monsterlink|Shadow demon}}- Demonic summoners which can quickly flood their surroundings with summoned demons and [[Shadow Creatures]].

{{monsterlink|Tormentor}}- A demon that casts [[Pain]] and [[Torment]] and is faster than average.

===Tier-1 Demons===
Tier-1 Demons (also known as Greater Demons) are among the deadliest opponents in ''Dungeon Crawl''. All tier-1 demons can see invisible, and all Fiends are capable of inflicting [[Torment]]. Fighting or even being in sight of multiple tier-1 demons is not recommended. 

{{monsterlink|Brimstone fiend}}- Fiends that specialize in [[damnation]] as well as torment. Vulnerable to cold. 

{{monsterlink|Executioner}}- Moves twice as fast as normal and will cast [[Haste]] at the slightest provocation. With its speed and 3 melee attacks, it can tear lightly armoured characters to shreds.  

{{monsterlink|Hell sentinel}}- A highly durable demonic construct with painful [[spiny|spines]] and both [[Damnation]] and [[Iron Shot]].

{{monsterlink|Ice fiend}}- Fiends that have torment and [[Bolt of Cold]], but are most dangerous in melee with their powerful freezing attacks. Vulnerable to fire.

{{monsterlink|Tzitzimitl}}- Terrifying divinities that can damage both the living and the undead with an assortment of cold and negative energy spells.

===Archdemons===
The most powerful demons of them all, these beings are all [[unique]] creatures that are usually found as boss-type enemies. Many of them serve as guardians of various [[runes of Zot]].

{{monsterlink|Geryon}}- The gatekeeper of [[Hell]], Geryon stands between adventurers and the entrances to the four hells. His [[Horn of Geryon|horn]] can call in endless waves of [[hell beast]]s.

{{monsterlink|Asmodeus}}- Lord of [[Gehenna]] and unparalleled master of [[Fire Magic]], Asmodeus guards the obsidian rune of Zot.

{{monsterlink|Dispater}}- Lord of [[the Iron City of Dis]], Dispater commands powerful [[Earth Magic]] and legions of powerful demons. His vaults hold the iron rune of Zot.

{{monsterlink|Ereshkigal}}- Lady of [[Tartarus]], she can [[paralyze]], [[torment]], and [[silence]] her foes. She was charged with protecting the bone rune of Zot.

{{monsterlink|Antaeus}}- A corrupted [[titan]] who rules over [[Cocytus]]. Antaeus fights foes with his massive strength augmented by powerful [[Ice Magic|Ice]] and [[Air Magic]]. He watches over the icy rune of Zot.

{{monsterlink|Pandemonium lord}}- Powerful demons that individually rule portions of [[Pandemonium]]. Their powers and appearances vary greatly.

{{monsterlink|Mnoleg}}- Guardian of the glowing rune of Zot, Mnoleg and its minions will [[malmutate]] the crap out of anyone who challenges them... if they don't eat your brains first.

{{monsterlink|Lom Lobon}}- Guardian of the magical rune of Zot, Lom Lobon possesses some of the strongest spells in the game and heads a cabal of [[wizard (monster)|wizards]].

{{monsterlink|Cerebov}}- Guardian of the fiery rune of Zot, Cerebov's [[Sword of Cerebov|sword]] allows it to burn even those with full fire resistance.

{{monsterlink|Gloorx Vloq}}- Guardian of the dark rune of Zot, Gloorx Vloq is extremely fast and can seriously harm both the living and the undead.

===Demonic creatures===
While not considered standard demons in and of themselves, these creatures have demonic [[holiness]], making them vulnerable to weapons of [[holy wrath]].

{{monsterlink|Apocalypse crab}}- [[Abyss]]al crustaceans that spew clouds of pure [[chaos]] at their prey.

{{monsterlink|Small abomination}}- Horrible mockeries of life made from several corpses that have been mashed haphazardly together.

{{monsterlink|Large abomination}}- Unrecognizable combinations of body parts that are somewhat slower but far more powerful than their smaller brethren.

{{monsterlink|Demonic crawler}}- Swift demonic bugs that are often found in the [[Spider's Nest]].

{{monsterlink|Doom hound}}- Demonic [[list of canines|hounds]] that roam [[Tartarus]]. Their howls attract the attention of other residents of that deathly realm.

{{monsterlink|Efreet}}- Spirits of fire who wield [[flaming]] [[scimitar]]s and powerful [[Fire Magic]].

{{monsterlink|Hell hound}}- Fire-breathing [[list of canines|canines]] that travel in packs.

{{monsterlink|Hell hog}}- Demonic swine that travel in small herds and breathe [[Fireball]]s.

{{monsterlink|Hellephant}}- Enormous, hellish [[elephant]]s that will roast you with their fire breath before trampling you to jelly.

{{monsterlink|Rakshasa}}- Demons that specialize in illusions. They hide themselves in a crowd of illusory copies.

{{monsterlink|Tentacled monstrosity}}- Enormous tentacled behemoths that roam the [[Realm of Zot]] and can swiftly crush the life out of those who allow them into close combat.

{{monsterlink|Wendigo}}- Demons that fire paralysing bolts of electricity and shatter [[simulacra]] into devastating explosions of icy fragments.

===Unique demons===
These beings aren't powerful enough to be archdemons but are strong enough to be particularly noteworthy.

{{monsterlink|Azrael}}- An [[efreet]] who has learned how to hurl [[damnation]] in addition to more more mundane types of fire. Travels with a pack of fiery underlings.

{{monsterlink|Grinder}}- A notoriously deadly [[shadow imp]] who appears dangerously early in the [[Dungeon]].

{{monsterlink|Ignacio}}- An [[executioner]] who is even more deadly than usual, thanks in no small part to the [[executioner's axe]] he carries.

{{monsterlink|Mara}}- Master of illusions, Mara can force his foes to fight their double. His own magic isn't anything to sneeze at, either.

{{monsterlink|Nellie}}- An unusually beefy [[hellephant]] that only appears in [[Dungeon Sprint]].

{{Red|D}} [[Image:Serpent of Hell (Gehenna).png]][[Image:Serpent of Hell (Cocytus).png]][[Image:Serpent of Hell (Tartarus).png]][[Image:Serpent of Hell (Dis).png]] '''[[Serpent of Hell]]''' - A three-headed demonic [[list of dragons|dragon]] that changes its appearance and abilities to match the [[Hell]] it resides in.

===Retired demons===
{{monsterlink|Midge}}- Tiny, flying imps that were little more than minor nuisances at best.

{{monsterlink|Hairy devil}}- Boring and weak demonic melee fighters.

{{monsterlink|Iron devil}}- Upgraded iron imps with good AC and a variety of resistances. Replaced with [[rust devil]]s.

{{monsterlink|Pit fiend}}- Huge winged demons that could cast both [[hellfire]] and [[torment]]. Were removed in favor of [[hell sentinel]]s.

{{monsterlink|Rotting devil}}- Shambling demons that inflicted [[rot]] with their fetid touch and trailed clouds of [[miasma]] wherever they went.

{{monsterlink|Blue devil}}- Flying devils that resisted cold and poison, but were vulnerable to fire. They had no spells, but could swoop towards their targets from several tiles away.
